refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the standard deviation for the specified attribute of the input array.
refnamediv.para:
deprecated
stdev Deprecated. The stdev operator may be removed in the future. Use the stdev aggregate instead.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: standard deviation The stdev operator takes a set of scalar values from an array attribute and returns the standard deviation of those values.

refsect1.title: Inputs
refsect1.para:
The stdev operator takes the following arguments:
array: a source array with one or more attributes and one or more dimensions.
attribute: Optional attribute. If no attribute is provided, the first attribute in the source array is used.
dimension_n: An optional list of dimensions to group by.

informalexample.para: This example finds the standard deviation of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para:
Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0];

Store values of random values between 0 and 1 in m3x3:
AFL% store(build(m3x3,random()%9/10.0),m3x3); [ [(0.5),(0.4),(0.7)], [(0.6),(0.5),(0.4)], [(0.5),(0.3),(0.3)] ]

Select the standard deviation of each row of m3x3:
AFL% aggregate(m3x3,stdev(val),i); [(0.152753),(0.1),(0.11547)]
